Here are the answers to **4.7.4 Module Quiz - Physical Layer**, formatted as requested:

---

### Question 1

**A network administrator is troubleshooting connectivity issues on a server. Using a tester, the administrator notices that the signals generated by the server NIC are distorted and not usable. In which layer of the OSI model is the error categorized?**

| Option | Answer             | Explanation                                                                |
| ------ | ------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Presentation layer | âŒ Incorrect. Presentation layer deals with data formatting and encryption. |
| ğŸ…‘     | Network layer      | âŒ Incorrect. Network layer deals with IP addressing and routing.           |
| ğŸ…’     | Physical layer     | âœ… Correct. This layer is responsible for signal transmission.              |
| ğŸ…“     | Data link layer    | âŒ Incorrect. Data link layer handles MAC addressing and framing.           |

---

### Question 2

**What type of cable is used to connect a workstation serial port to a Cisco router console port?**

| Option | Answer           | Explanation                                               |
| ------ | ---------------- | --------------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Crossover        | âŒ Incorrect. Used between similar devices like PC-to-PC.  |
| ğŸ…‘     | Rollover         | âœ… Correct. Used to connect to Cisco device console ports. |
| ğŸ…’     | Straight-through | âŒ Incorrect. Used for PC-to-switch or switch-to-router.   |
| ğŸ…“     | Coaxial          | âŒ Incorrect. Not used for serial or console connections.  |

---

### Question 3

**Why are two strands of fiber used for a single fiber optic connection?**

| Option | Answer                   | Explanation                                                                |
| ------ | ------------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Travel longer distances  | âŒ Incorrect. Thatâ€™s an attribute of fiber, not the reason for two strands. |
| ğŸ…‘     | Prevent crosstalk        | âŒ Incorrect. Crosstalk is minimal in fiber optics.                         |
| ğŸ…’     | Increase speed           | âŒ Incorrect. Speed is not increased by having two strands.                 |
| ğŸ…“     | Full-duplex connectivity | âœ… Correct. One strand transmits, the other receives.                       |

---

### Question 4

**Which procedure is used to reduce the effect of crosstalk in copper cables?**

| Option | Answer                       | Explanation                                                             |
| ------ | ---------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Proper grounding             | âŒ Incorrect. Helps with electrical safety, not directly with crosstalk. |
| ğŸ…‘     | Twisting opposing wire pairs | âœ… Correct. Twisting cancels out interference between pairs.             |
| ğŸ…’     | Metallic shielding           | âŒ Incorrect. It reduces EMI, not crosstalk inside pairs.                |
| ğŸ…“     | Avoiding sharp bends         | âŒ Incorrect. Prevents signal degradation, not crosstalk.                |

---

### Question 5

**What is one advantage of using fiber optic cabling rather than copper cabling?**

| Option | Answer                       | Explanation                                                |
| ------ | ---------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Usually cheaper              | âŒ Incorrect. Fiber is generally more expensive.            |
| ğŸ…‘     | Installed around sharp bends | âŒ Incorrect. Bending can damage fiber.                     |
| ğŸ…’     | Easier to terminate          | âŒ Incorrect. Copper is easier to terminate.                |
| ğŸ…“     | Carry signals much farther   | âœ… Correct. Fiber can transmit over much greater distances. |

---

### Question 6

**Under which situation would a wireless connection be recommended?**

| Option | Answer                            | Explanation                                              |
| ------ | --------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Device has only Ethernet NIC      | âŒ Incorrect. Needs a wireless NIC to connect wirelessly. |
| ğŸ…‘     | Device needs dedicated connection | âŒ Incorrect. Wired is more suitable for performance.     |
| ğŸ…’     | Device needs mobility             | âœ… Correct. Wireless supports mobility for users.         |
| ğŸ…“     | High concentration of RFI         | âŒ Incorrect. RFI degrades wireless performance.          |

---

### Question 7

**Which type of UTP cable is used to connect a PC to a switch port?**

| Option | Answer           | Explanation                                          |
| ------ | ---------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Console          | âŒ Incorrect. Used to configure network devices.      |
| ğŸ…‘     | Rollover         | âŒ Incorrect. Used for console connections.           |
| ğŸ…’     | Crossover        | âŒ Incorrect. Used for similar devices like PC to PC. |
| ğŸ…“     | Straight-through | âœ… Correct. Used to connect PC to switch.             |

---

### Question 8

**What is the definition of bandwidth?**

| Option | Answer                                       | Explanation                                          |
| ------ | -------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Speed of bits over time                      | âŒ Incorrect. That defines data rate.                 |
| ğŸ…‘     | Speed bits travel on network                 | âŒ Incorrect. Bandwidth is about capacity, not speed. |
| ğŸ…’     | Amount of data that can flow in a given time | âœ… Correct. It defines the data-carrying capacity.    |
| ğŸ…“     | Usable data transferred                      | âŒ Incorrect. Thatâ€™s throughput.                      |

---

### Question 9

**Which statement correctly describes frame encoding?**

| Option | Answer                                               | Explanation                                          |
| ------ | ---------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | One wave modifies another                            | âŒ Incorrect. Thatâ€™s modulation.                      |
| ğŸ…‘     | Data and clock signal sent together                  | âŒ Incorrect. Thatâ€™s clock synchronization.           |
| ğŸ…’     | Generates physical signals                           | âŒ Incorrect. Thatâ€™s signaling.                       |
| ğŸ…“     | Converts bits into predictable codes for distinction | âœ… Correct. Helps distinguish data from control bits. |

---

### Question 10

**What is a characteristic of UTP cabling?**

| Option | Answer              | Explanation                                       |
| ------ | ------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Cancellation        | âœ… Correct. Twisted pairs cancel out interference. |
| ğŸ…‘     | Cladding            | âŒ Incorrect. Refers to fiber optics.              |
| ğŸ…’     | Electrical immunity | âŒ Incorrect. UTP is vulnerable to EMI.            |
| ğŸ…“     | Woven copper/foil   | âŒ Incorrect. Thatâ€™s shielded cabling, not UTP.    |

---

### Question 11

**Possible cause of wireless LAN interference in park ranger office?**

| Option | Answer                     | Explanation                                                          |
| ------ | -------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Microwave oven             | âœ… Correct. Microwaves emit frequencies that cause WiFi interference. |
| ğŸ…‘     | Trees surrounding office   | âŒ Incorrect. Trees affect signal strength, not distortion.           |
| ğŸ…’     | Elevated location          | âŒ Incorrect. Doesnâ€™t cause interference.                             |
| ğŸ…“     | Number of wireless devices | âŒ Incorrect. May cause congestion, but not interference.             |

---

### Question 12

**Purpose of the OSI physical layer?**

| Option | Answer                      | Explanation                                               |
| ------ | --------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Controlling access to media | âŒ Incorrect. Done at data link layer.                     |
| ğŸ…‘     | Transmitting bits           | âœ… Correct. Physical layer sends raw bits over the medium. |
| ğŸ…’     | Error detection on frames   | âŒ Incorrect. Done at data link layer.                     |
| ğŸ…“     | Exchanging frames           | âŒ Incorrect. Done by data link layer.                     |

---

### Question 13

**Which characteristic describes crosstalk?**

| Option | Answer                                | Explanation                                                    |
| ------ | ------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Fluorescent lighting distortion       | âŒ Incorrect. That's EMI, not crosstalk.                        |
| ğŸ…‘     | Signal distortion from adjacent wires | âœ… Correct. Crosstalk is interference from nearby signal wires. |
| ğŸ…’     | Weakening over long distances         | âŒ Incorrect. Thatâ€™s attenuation.                               |
| ğŸ…“     | Wireless loss over distance           | âŒ Incorrect. Not related to cabling.                           |

---

### Question 14

**What is indicated by the term throughput?**

| Option | Answer                     | Explanation                                         |
| ------ | -------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | Guaranteed ISP speed       | âŒ Incorrect. Thatâ€™s service level agreement (SLA).  |
| ğŸ…‘     | Capacity of medium         | âŒ Incorrect. Thatâ€™s bandwidth.                      |
| ğŸ…’     | Usable data transferred    | âœ… Correct. Throughput is actual data transfer rate. |
| ğŸ…“     | Bits transferred over time | âŒ Incorrect. Closer to bandwidth, not throughput.   |
| ğŸ…”     | Time for message to travel | âŒ Incorrect. Thatâ€™s latency.                        |

---

### Question 15

**Which standards organization oversees development of wireless LAN standards?**

| Option | Answer | Explanation                                        |
| ------ | ------ | -------------------------------------------------- |
| ğŸ…     | IANA   | âŒ Incorrect. Manages IP addresses and ports.       |
| ğŸ…‘     | IEEE   | âœ… Correct. IEEE 802.11 defines wireless LANs.      |
| ğŸ…’     | ISO    | âŒ Incorrect. Develops international standards.     |
| ğŸ…“     | TIA    | âŒ Incorrect. Focuses on telecommunications wiring. |
